title: Tuna Rigatoni And The Shine
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Tuna Rigatoni And The Shine a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 3g of protein, 15g of fat, and a total of 214 calories. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.12 per serving. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. 4 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. If you have to 2 chilis, basil, rigatoni, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 71%. This score is pretty good. Try Sweet And Spicy Tuna Rigatoni, Easy Creamy Parmesan Rigatoni (Rigatoni Alla Panna), and Rigatoni Al Forno (Baked Rigatoni) with Roasted Asparagus and On for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
